titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stanford Humanities Center, Marta Sutton Weeks Distinguished Visitor Program, Videorecordings
Stanford Humanities Center, Marta Sutton Weeks Distinguished Visitor Program, Videorecordings

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: Stanford Humanities Center, Marta Sutton Weeks Distinguished Visitor Program, videorecordings
did.abstract: Collection includes recordings (VHS and DVDcam) of talks by Anne Fausto-Sterling in 2003 and Linda Williams in 2005. Fausto-Sterling's talks were titled "The Bare Bones of Sex" and "Thinking Systematically about the Emergence of Gender." Williams' talks were titled "Hard-Core Eroticism: In the Realm of the Senses" and "Going All the Way: Carnal Knowledge on American Screens (1960-71)."

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: Access: tapes that are not VHS will need to be reformatted prior to use.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Stanford Humanities Center, Marta Sutton Weeks Distinguished Visitor Program, Videorecordings (V0254). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: A gift to endowment from Marta Sutton Weeks in 1987 provides funds to bring visiting distinguished lecturers to Stanford University for stays varying in duration from one week up to one quarter.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Collection includes recordings (VHS and DVDcam) of talks by Anne Fausto-Sterling in 2003 and Linda Williams in 2005. Fausto-Sterling's talks were titled "The Bare Bones of Sex" and "Thinking Systematically about the Emergence of Gender." Williams' talks were titled "Hard-Core Eroticism: In the Realm of the Senses" and "Going All the Way: Carnal Knowledge on American Screens (1960-71)."
